#Created from Settings.JSON: Grouped into Tab names, reusing the original section within that

CHAT.Quick Chat #7: Be careful at the first corner

DRIVING AIDS.Auto Blip#: Whether to automatically blip with manual shifting but auto-clutch (non-semiautomatic trans only)
DRIVING AIDS.Auto Headlights#: Adds an automatic options and set it to the default setting. Automatically turn on and off headlights dependent on weather conditions.
DRIVING AIDS.Auto Lift#: Whether to automatically lift with manual shifting but auto-clutch (non-semiautomatic trans only)
DRIVING AIDS.Auto Shift Override Time#: How long after an automatic shift before user is allowed to manually shift
DRIVING AIDS.Auto Windscreen Wipers#: Adds an automatic option and set it to the default setting. Automatically turn on and off windscreen wipers dependent on weather conditions.
DRIVING AIDS.Automatic Pit Speed Limiter#: Automatically enables/disables the pit speed limiter when entering/exiting the pits
DRIVING AIDS.Drive AI Physics#: Only works in Dev builds, single player when you toggle to AI "control"
DRIVING AIDS.Driving Line#: Displays a visualization of the driving line, either from paddock to the pitlane, paddock & entering the pits from race track on a scheduled stop, or all the time.
DRIVING AIDS.Hold Brakes#: When you enter the vehicle, hold brakes until it is shifted out of neutral
DRIVING AIDS.Hold Clutch On Start#: For auto-shifting only: whether to hold clutch for standing start (to allow revving without moving)
DRIVING AIDS.Manual Shift Override Time#: How long after a manual shift until auto shifting resumes (if auto-shifting is enabled)
DRIVING AIDS.No AI Control#: AI never has control over car (except autopit)
DRIVING AIDS.Old Tire Model#: Only works in Dev builds, drive with old tire model
DRIVING AIDS.Repeat Shifts#: 0 = no repeat shift detection, 1 = detect and eliminate accidental repeat shifts within 100ms, 2 = 150ms, 3 = 200ms, 4 = 250ms, 5 = prevent shifting again before previous shift is completed
DRIVING AIDS.Steering Help#: Now 3 levels, although full level now comes with a weight penalty by default
DRIVING AIDS.Track Markers#: Extra track markers for turning and braking

Game Options.Active Sleep Time#: ms to sleep each loop if the game is the active app (-1 to disable).  Consider setting to 1 or more if you are running a dedicated server on the same machine.
Game Options.Attack Zone AR Time#: Amount of time (in seconds) that the AR elements of the Attack zone will stay visible after being activated
Game Options.Auto Line Smoothing#: bit field where 1 = fastest line, 2 = left, 4 = right, and so on; add up each path's value you want to smooth for this parameter; note this causes multiplayer join lag!
Game Options.Auto Skip Garaged Vehicles#: If 1, vehicles in garage stalls will be skipped when cycling cameras. Set this value to 0 to see all vehicles; the left shift key can be held while cycling to dynamically suppend auto skipping.
Game Options.Auto-change Opponent List#: whether to change the single-player allowed vehicle filter when player changes vehicles
Game Options.Automatic Pit Menu#: brings up pit menu automatically: 0=disabled, 1=upon pit ENTRY, change cockpit menu but do not bring up HUD, 2=pit ENTRY->cockpit & HUD, 3=pit REQUEST->cockpit menu only, 4=pit REQUEST->cockpit & HUD
Game Options.Clock presentation#: false=12 hour clock, true=24 hour clock
Game Options.CrashRecovery#: 0=none, 1=artificially keep cars on track, 2=flip cars upright, 3=both
Game Options.Custom Replay Folder#: Specify a custom folder where to store the replays
Game Options.Damper Units#: Display dampers (shocks) in garage as: 0 = setting (e.g. 1-20), 1 = rate (e.g. 1000-9000 N/m/s)
Game Options.Disable Resume in Replay#: if this is true, hitting resume in replay mode will send you directy to track, (so that if you are running mod mode, you can get a fastest path from a replay file
Game Options.Disconnected Results#: show results for clients disconnected at end of prac/qual/warmup
Game Options.Drivers Per Vehicle Player#: Drivers per Vehicle, Player Vehicle. SP only
Game Options.Equipped Scenario Plans#: What scenario plans are currently equipped.  filled with your equipped scenario names in the following format: |scenarioName1|scenarioName2|scenarioName3 etc etc
Game Options.Find Default Setup#: If 1, attempts to ensure player has default setup ... only works well if only one vehicle class in RFM
Game Options.Fixed Setups#: use fixed setups specified in UserData\<plr>\FavoriteAndFixedSetups.gal (based on track and vehicle class)
Game Options.Fixed Upgrades#: whether multiplayer vehicles use the closest standard upgrade class package
Game Options.FreeSettings#: -1=use RFM/season/GDB default, or add to allow minor changes with fixed/parc ferme setups: 1=steering lock, 2=brake pressure, 4=starting fuel, 8=fuel strategy 16=tire compound, 32=brake bias, 64=front wing, 128=engine settings
Game Options.Full Player Replay#: do not drop any player replay events
Game Options.Inactive Sleep Time#: Number of milliseconds to sleep each message loop if the game is not the active application (-1 to disable).  will give more CPU to other apps when minimized, etc.
Game Options.Keep Received Setups#: 0=do not accept, 1=keep until next track, 2=keep until exit, 3=keep forever
Game Options.Limited Tire Rules#: when enabled, the amount of tires available per compound will be restricted to the set amounts
Game Options.Limited Tire Rules Tires Available In Ga: How many tires are available in the garage
Game Options.Limited Tire Rules, Keep Tire Inv Track: when enabled tire inventories will be kept when going to the next track, otherwise they are cleared
Game Options.Mark Server Mods Temp#: If true any mods downloaded from dedicated servers will be marked as temporary and deleted on game launch
Game Options.Measurement Units#: Units for everything EXCEPT speed (0 = metric, 1 = english/imperial)
Game Options.Min drive time allowed for 2 driver team: Minimum total driving time allowed in a race, -1 = auto generate. in seconds. for 2 driver teams
Game Options.Min drive time allowed for 3 driver team: Minimum total driving time allowed in a race, -1 = auto generate. in seconds. for 3 driver teams
Game Options.Monitor Admin Postfix#: what is displayed after multiplayer administrator driver names in monitor
Game Options.Monitor Auto Replay#: whether to automatically start a replay when returning to monitor
Game Options.Multi-session Results#: whether to store all sessions at a track in a single results file, new default is one session per file
Game Options.Number Race Results#: how many results files to store (using default naming convention only!)
Game Options.Number Track Replays#: how many replays to store for each track (using default naming convention only!)
Game Options.One Lap To Go Warning#: Race only: 0=none, 1=message, 2=white flag, 3=both, Race+Qual: add 4.  Feature not implemented for timed races or lapped vehicles.

Game Options.Pause If Focus Lost#: whether to automatically pause if window loses focus (single-player only)
Game Options.Pitstop Description#: Gives extra info about what's taking time in pitstop
Game Options.Qualifying Laps#: 2 = default, 255 = unlimited, otherwise # of laps (min of 3)
Game Options.Race Stint Offset#: Offset each scheduled pitstop in case you want to carry extra fuel
Game Options.Realtime Splits#: 0=show race splits at sectors only, 1=realtime splits (can be toggled while driving with pit decrement key
Game Options.Record Hotlap#: whether to record hotlap or not (must have replay recording on)
Game Options.Record Replays#: whether to record replays or not
Game Options.Relevant Setups Only#: 0 = show all setups in folder, 1 = only show setups for your current vehicle
Game Options.Remember Onboard Changes#: If onboard changes will persist after a garage visit and next session
Game Options.Save All Replay Sessions#: whether to save the replay from each session
Game Options.Show Extra Lap#: -1 = show fractional lap (e.g. 3.7), 0 = show laps completed (e.g. 3), 1 = show lap you are on (e.g. 4)
Game Options.Smart Pitcrew#: Pitcrew does things even if you mistakenly forgot to ask (one example is changing a damaged tire)
Game Options.Speed Comp Dist#: <= 2.0: fraction of track length, > 2.0: actual distance in meters for max speed comp
Game Options.Spotter Behind#: Range behind at which spotter may comment on vehicles around you (range ahead is 40% of this value because those vehicles are easier to see)
Game Options.Standings Func#: standings scroll with pit up/down keys: 0=no wraparound, 1=wraparound, 2=auto-scroll (can be changed while driving with pit increment key)
Game Options.Starting Pos#: Only used if no qualifying session in single-player
Game Options.Stop go penalties#: when false, stop/go penalties are disabled and replaced with drive through penalties
Game Options.Temporary Replay Keys#: whether original replay mode is restored after releasing instant replay (arrow) keys
Game Options.Tire Warmers#: If the use of tire warmers is allowed
Game Options.Track Limits Info#: The amount of on screen information to show about track cutting 0 = Default, 1 = Penalties Only, 2 = Debug (Mod Dev only).
Game Options.Transparent Trainer Lap#: 0=off, 1=use saved lap (never updated), 2=use best lap (starts with saved lap but updates if faster), 3=always use last lap
Game Options.Transparent Trainer Lead Time#: how far ahead it starts the lap in seconds
Game Options.User Vehicle Data#: 0=save with user mod data (in CCH files), 1=save separately (in all_vehicles.ini)
Game Options.Vehicle Removal#: Seconds until stationary vehicle is removed from track
Game Options.Vehicle classes affected by drive time#: What vehicle classes are subject to the min drive time.  Classes are seperated with |
Game Options.Wait For All Plugins To Load#: in single-player, delay race starts until all plugins load
Game Options.practice length#: 0 = default, otherwise minutes (multiplayer version in that file)
Game Options.qualifying length#: 0 = default, otherwise minutes (multiplayer version in that file)
Game Options.warmup length#: 0 = default, otherwise minutes (multiplayer version in that file)

Game Options.AI Aggression Mode#: How aggressively the AI will attempt overtakes and hold positions
Game Options.AI Brake_Grip Usage#: Fraction of theoretical brake grip that AI attempt to use (can be overrode in HDV)
Game Options.AI Brake_Power Usage#: Fraction of theoretical brake power that AI attempt to use (can be overrode in HDV)
Game Options.AI Corner_Grip Usage#: Fraction of theoretical cornering grip that AI attempt to use (can be overrode in HDV)
Game Options.AI Formation by Position#: If true, AI will line up for yellow or formation laps by fixed position behind the pace car, if false they will line up relative to specific car they should be following
Game Options.AI Fuel Mult#: Additional fuel multiplier for AIs because of their driving style
Game Options.AI Logic Override#: use bitfields to disable certain AI behaviors. 1= blocking line, 2 = flexible superspeedway driving line
Game Options.AI Mistakes#: a range of (intentional) AI mistakes from 0.0 (none) to 1.0 (sometimes).  Anything above 1.0 multiplies the frequency
Game Options.AI Power Calibration#: Adjustments with AI strength (0=none, or add the following: 1=power, 2=gearing, 4=fuel)
Game Options.AI Vocal Strategy#: Mod Dev Only: Should the AI talk their strategy decisions out loud? 0 = No, 1 = Selected AI Only, 2 = All AI
Game Options.Drivers Per Vehicle AI#: Drivers per vehicle, AI teams. SP only
Game Options.Fixed AI Setups#: whether AI use the fixed setups, only applicable if "Fixed Setups" is also enabled (and can be used in single player to have the AIs use your favorite setup)
Game Options.Ghost AI#: If 1, AI car will ignore others and be uncollidable.  disabled for standard builds
Game Options.Monitor AI Postfix#: what is displayed after AI driver names in monitor (multiplayer only)

Game Options.Broadcast Custom Cameras#: Whether to load custom cameras from the Userdata\Cameras folder. Retail Only. Camera File names can be found by inspecting Trace log files, lines beneaths 'Entered CamMan::Init()'
Game Options.Broadcast Focused Car Change Time Delay#: Time delay before changing focused car. This allows multiple presses of previous / next vehicle before moving to the car you desire.
Game Options.Broadcast Group Tracking Mode#: 0 = Off, 1 = Race Mode (enabled in race session only, with extra zoom on lap 1), 2 = On
Game Options.Broadcast Group Tracking Range Lap 1#: Specific scalar for the first lap of the race when using Race mode.
Game Options.Broadcast Group Tracking Range#: Range of cars to track in time
Game Options.Broadcast Group Tracking Zoom Maximum#: The maximum the camera can zoom out.
Game Options.Broadcast Group Tracking Zoom Strength#: How strongly the camera zooms out as more cars are being tracked.
Game Options.Broadcast Persistent Zoom#: Whether to retain manual zoom adjustments when the tracking camera changes. 0 = Disabled, 1 = Enabled
Game Options.Broadcast Tracking Change Blend#: Tracking Change Blend with move the tracking camera focus point from one car to another when viewed vehicle changes and they are still visible with the same camera. 0 = Disabled, 1 = Enabled
Game Options.Broadcast Tracking Change Max Time#: The maximum time difference between cars to have a blended tracking change. If set to 0, this calculation is skipped.

Graphic Options.Allow Letterboxing#: whether we allow letterboxing (during replays, for example)
Graphic Options.Always Rebuild Collision#: Build collision database everytime tracks are loaded (for development purposes)
Graphic Options.Auto Detail Framerate#: Details and visible vehicles will be automatically reduced (by up to half) if framerate is under this threshold (0 to disable)
Graphic Options.Box Outline#: whether to draw box on ground around pitstall and grid location when necessary; -1=off, 0-16777215=RGB color
Graphic Options.Delay Video Swap#: Whether to delay video swap if card is busy - this should only be used if framerate clearly improves - otherwise it is only delaying response time
Graphic Options.Display Driver Radar#: whether or not to display flags information on the driver overlay
Graphic Options.Display Icons#: Icons displayed if HUD is off: 0 = none, 1 = flags only, 2 = all
Graphic Options.Driver Overlay Car Info#: whether or not to display car information on the driver overlay
Graphic Options.Driver Overlay Chat Notifications#: whether or not to display chat messages on the driver overlay
Graphic Options.Driver Overlay Flags#: whether or not to display flags information on the driver overlay
Graphic Options.Driver Overlay Game Notifications#: whether or not to display game notifications on the driver overlay
Graphic Options.Driver Overlay MFD Timing Mode#: How to show time differences on the MFD Timing screen
Graphic Options.Driver Overlay MFD Timing View#: Which data to show on the the MFD Timing screen
Graphic Options.Driver Overlay Race Notifications#: whether or not to display race notifications on the driver overlay
Graphic Options.Driver Overlay Standings Mode#: whether or not to display standings information on the driver overlay
Graphic Options.Driver Overlay Timing Info#: whether or not to display timing information on the driver overlay
Graphic Options.Dynamic Vertex Buffers#: Enable / Disable use of dynamic vertex buffers
Graphic Options.Enable Legacy HDR Profiles#: Whether to enable legacy HDR profiles
Graphic Options.Engine Emitter Flow#: Whether engine smoke/flames flow over emitting vehicle
Graphic Options.Environment Reflections#: Low/Medium/HIgh/Ultra = live cubic mapping is used (if track and car are setup properly)
Graphic Options.Extra Visible Vehicles#: Extra vehicles shown in non-driving situations
Graphic Options.Full Tire Shader#: Turn off only if you get wacky wheels (typically on old, unsupported video cards that are not truly compliant)
Graphic Options.Gap Check#: Test for verts that are within X meters but not the exact same, reported to trace.txt and visible by pressing Ctrl-H three times (Dev build only; 0.0 to disable)
Graphic Options.Garage Car Detail#: LOD multiplier when vehicle is in garage (0.01-1.00)
Graphic Options.Heat FX Fade Speed#: Speed at which exhaust heat effects reduce by half (0 to completely disable)
Graphic Options.Max Framerate#: 0 to disable (note: positive numbers only, we always use the 'alternate' method now)
Graphic Options.Max Headlights#: Max headlights visible relative to your car. (Note current system only allows upto 20)
Graphic Options.Opponent Texture Override#: For opponents' vehicle textures: -1=use Opponent Detail, 0-2=override value
Graphic Options.Overlay Height Offset#: Distance from geometry to help sort drawing skids and grooves
Graphic Options.Overlay Z Bias#: Draw-sorting bias for skids and grooves (0 = none)
Graphic Options.Player Livery#: Overrides default paint job for track
Graphic Options.Player Texture Override#: For player's vehicle textures: -1=use Player Detail, 0-2=override value

Graphic Options.Rain FX Quality#: Scales the quality of rain FX
Graphic Options.Raindrop Flow#: Add to enable: 1=flow over current 2=flow over other vehicles
Graphic Options.Rainspray Flow#: Add to enable: 1=flow over current 2=flow over other vehicles
Graphic Options.Real Road System#: If true, dynamic road effects are used (can only be turned off in Dev mode)
Graphic Options.Rearview_Back_Clip#: Back plane distance for mirror (0.0 = use default for scene)
Graphic Options.Rearview_Front_Clip#: Front plane distance for mirror (0.0 = use default for scene)
Graphic Options.Render Once Per VSync#: Attempts to render once per vsync; 1 = use timer, no wait; 2 = use vblank, no wait; 3 = use vblank, wait
Graphic Options.Road Reflections#: Low/Medium/High/Ultra = reflected objects are generated for wet road and heat mirage
Graphic Options.Screen Space Ambient Occlusion#: Enable Screen Space Ambient Occlusion Effect
Graphic Options.Screenshot Depth Alpha#: Save the scene depth in the alpha channel of screenshots
Graphic Options.Showroom Background Rendering#: If we want to render the showroom background or not for alpha cut out screenshots of cars. This can be changed by pressing Key 1 to toggle the option when in the showroom.
Graphic Options.Smoke Flow#: Whether all smoke/flames/dust flow over non-emitting vehicles
Graphic Options.Spark Flow#: Add to enable: 1=flow over current 2=flow over other vehicles
Graphic Options.Sun Occlusion#: If true, sunlight is affected by cloud cover
Graphic Options.Synchronize Frame#: Extrapolate graphics using estimated render time in attempt to more accurately synchronize physics with graphics, 0.0 (off) - 1.0 (full)
Graphic Options.Texture Filter#: Texture Filtering level: 0 = bilinear, 1 = trilinear, 2 = X2 AF, 3 = X4 AF, 4 = X8 AF, 5 = X16 AF
Graphic Options.Texture Sharpening#: Sharpen textures using MIP LOD bias - 0=Off, 1=+2.0(very blurry), 2=+1.0(blurry), 3=-1.0(sharp), 4=-2.0(very sharp), 5=0.0(auto)
Graphic Options.Tire Emitter Flow#: Whether tire smoke/dust flow over emitting vehicle
Graphic Options.Tire Ground Offset#: Offset so tire shadows work properly on ground
Graphic Options.Transparency AA#: Soften edges around alpha test objects
Graphic Options.Vehicle Flow Offset#: Offset below vehicle where sphere center is located
Graphic Options.Wind and Crowd Motion#: If true, trees respond to ambient wind, crowds have some random motion

Graphic Options.Car Vibration Mult1#: Primary engine vibration multiplier affects position of cameras attached directly to the car
Graphic Options.Car Vibration Mult2#: Secondary engine vibration multiplier affects orientation of cameras attached directly to the car
Graphic Options.Center Mirror Horiz#: use Ctrl+Alt+Seat* controls to save by vehicle
Graphic Options.Cockpit Vibration Freq1#: Primary rate of vibration affects eyepoint position (higher framerates allow higher rates)
Graphic Options.Cockpit Vibration Freq2#: Secondary rate of vibration affects eyepoint orientation
Graphic Options.Cockpit Vibration Mult1#: Primary aerodynamic vibration multiplier affects eyepoint position (base magnitude is in VEH or cockpit file)
Graphic Options.Cockpit Vibration Mult2#: Secondary aerodynamic vibration multiplier affects eyepoint orientation (base magnitude is in VEH or cockpit file)
Graphic Options.Exaggerate Yaw#: Visually exaggerates the heading angle of the vehicle by rotating the head (which may improve "feel")
Graphic Options.Glance Angle#: Angle to look left/right (yaw) w/ controller in radians (= degrees / 57)
Graphic Options.Glance Rate#: Rate to follow controller for glancing
Graphic Options.Head Physics#: Fraction of head physics movement applied to cockpit view (position AND rotation)
Graphic Options.Head Rotation#: Additional head physics multiplier affecting rotation only
Graphic Options.UI Refresh Rate#: Controls the maximum ui refresh rate when in race
Graphic Options.UI autonomous render thread#: UI has its own render thread

Graphic Options.HUD Mode#: whether or not to display the driver overlay heads-up display
Graphic Options.HUD Ultrawide Ratio#: How much of screens with a wider aspect ratio than 16:9 will be filled by the HUD horizontally
Graphic Options.Leanahead Angle#: Angle to lean head (roll) w/ steering in radians (= degrees / 57)
Graphic Options.Left Mirror Horiz#: use Ctrl+Seat* controls to save by vehicle
Graphic Options.Live TV Displays#: Live TV Displays on Track: 0=Off 1=Trackside Cameras Only 2=On
Graphic Options.Load Opponent Cockpits#: Whether to load gauges and LCD for opponents, don't turn off if you're planning on hot-swapping vehicles in multiplayer
Graphic Options.Logo Seconds#: puts up logo at corner of screen for first X seconds of each session
Graphic Options.Look Roll Angle#: Angle to lean head (roll) w/ controller in radians (= degrees / 57)
Graphic Options.Look Up/Down Angle#: Angle to look up/down (pitch) w/ controller in radians (= degrees / 57)
Graphic Options.Lookahead Angle#: Angle to lookahead (yaw) w/ steering in radians (= degrees / 57)
Graphic Options.Mirror Adjustment Horiz#: use Shift+Seat* controls to save by vehicle
Graphic Options.Mirror Physical X#: use Shift+Alt+Seat* controls to save by vehicle
Graphic Options.Mirror Physical Y#: note: these physical mirror position adjustments are for the in-cockpit center mirror only
Graphic Options.Moving Rearview#: Whether mirrors respond to head movement in cockpit (0=none, 1=position-only, 2=FOV-only, 3=both) - add 4 if you want to IGNORE head-tracking movement
Graphic Options.Rearview Cull#: Whether to cull objects in the rearview based on visgroups in the SCN file
Graphic Options.Rearview Driving#: false=Off, true=On, applies to nosecam, cockpit, and TV cockpit
Graphic Options.Rearview Independent#: Whether width (horizontal FOV) can be controlled independently of height (vertical FOV)
Graphic Options.Rearview Onboard#: false=Off, true=On, applies to onboard cams
Graphic Options.Rearview Swingman#: false=Off, true=On, applies to swingman only
Graphic Options.Rearview Width#: use Shift+Ctrl+Seat* controls to save by vehicle
Graphic Options.Right Mirror Horiz#: use Alt+Seat* controls to save by vehicle
Graphic Options.Self In Rearview#: Empty for nothing, * for everything, otherwise list comma-delimited instances you want _removed_
Graphic Options.Steady Framerate Thresh#: Allowed threshold in seconds to try to 'catch up' when falling behind using Max Framerate (use 0 for original behavior).  This helps steady the framerate but may introduce more latency.
Graphic Options.Steering Wheel#: 0=moving steering wheel, 1=non-moving steering wheel, 2=no steering wheel or arms (in cockpit only while player-controlled), 3=moving steering wheel but no arms
Graphic Options.VR Enable Hidden Area Mask#: Enable VR hidden area mask, may improve VR performance.
Graphic Options.VR HUD Depth#: Depth of the VR UI HUD screen
Graphic Options.VR HUD Scale#: Scale of the VR UI HUD screen
Graphic Options.VR IPD Scale#: VR IPD Scale: Adjusts IPD distance between eyes. 1.0 = default IPD distance, as reported by the HMD, below 1.0 = reduce, above 1.0 = increase
Graphic Options.VR Menu Depth#: Depth of the VR UI menu screen
Graphic Options.VR Menu Scale#: Scale of the VR UI menu screen
Graphic Options.VR Projection Mode#: VR Projection Mode: 0 = default, 1 = not in-plane displays HMDs
Graphic Options.Verify Refs#: Non-retail builds only: Verify HDV and GEN references in VEH file and log problems
Graphic Options.Vertical FOV Degrees#: 9=use default, otherwise is the FOV for attached cameras (horiz is calculated based on aspect ratio)
Graphic Options.Virtual Rearview In Cockpit#: applies to cockpit or TV cockpit

Race Conditions.Adjust Frozen Order#: Moves vehicles down the frozen track order under the safety car if they are causing the yellow and being passed.  0.0=off, 0.1-0.9=apply liberally, 1.0+=apply conservatively
Race Conditions.Flag Rules#: Level of rule enforcement, 0=none, 1=penalties only, 2=penalties & full-course yellows, 3=everything except DQs
Race Conditions.Force Formation#: if Formation Lap is Use Track Default, add the following to force: 1=standing start formations on, 2=standing formations off, 4=rolling start formations on, 8=rolling formations off
Race Conditions.Formation Lap#: 0=standing start, 1=formation lap & standing start, 2=lap behind safety car & rolling start, 3=use track default, 4=fast rolling start
Race Conditions.FullGrid#: When true we fill the grid with the most unique cars possible from selected classes, when false we use the real grids from the event
Race Conditions.Grid Walkthrough#: Cinematic walkthrough of vehicles before race
Race Conditions.ParcFerme#: 0=off, 1=no setup changes allowed between qual and race except for 'Free Settings'), 2=same unless rain, 3=use RFM default 'ParcFerme=<0-2>'
Race Conditions.PrivatePractice#: (note: used to be Private Test Day) 0=all cars practice visibly on track together, 1=only one car is visible at a time
Race Conditions.PrivateQualifying#: 0=all cars qualify visibly on track together, 1=only one car is visible at a time, 2=use default from RFM, season, or track entry PrivateQualifying=<0 or 1>
Race Conditions.Race Timer#: Seconds between displaying time remaining in race other than 1/5/10/30 minutes (zero disables)
Race Conditions.RaceStartingTime#: -3=random, -2=random daytime, -1=default RFM, 0-1439=minutes after midnight to start race
Race Conditions.RaceTimeScale#: -1 = use race distance percentage, 0 - 60 = multiply time by given factor
Race Conditions.RealRoadTimeScalePractice#: Applies to testday/practice/warmup: -1=scaled with session length, 0=static, 0.1-0.9=slow, 1=normal, 2=2x, etc.
Race Conditions.RealRoadTimeScaleQualifying#: Applies to any qualifying session: -1=scaled with session length, 0=static, 0.1-0.9=slow, 1=normal, 2=2x, etc.
Race Conditions.RealRoadTimeScaleRace#: Applies to any race session: -1=scaled with session length, 0=static, 0.1-0.9=slow, 1=normal, 2=2x, etc.
Race Conditions.Recon Pit Closed#: Time that pits are closed before formation lap (real-life is 900 seconds)
Race Conditions.Recon Pit Open#: Time that pits remain open for recon laps (real-life is 900 seconds)
Race Conditions.Recon Timer#: Whether timer is displayed in message box
Race Conditions.Safety Car Thresh#: Threshold for bringing out safety car (lower numbers -> more full-course yellows), please note that there are now RFM multipliers for this value
Race Conditions.TimeScaledWeather#: Whether weather time is scaled with session length
Race Conditions.Track Limits Points Allowed#: How many track limits penalty points to allow before receiving a penalty in race mode. For example once you receive this number of points you will receive a drive through penalty.
Race Conditions.Track Limits Rules#: How strict the Track Limits rules are. 0 = Disabled, 1 = Default, 2 = Strict, 3 = Relaxed.
Race Conditions.Unsportsmanlike Sensitivity#: 0.1 - 10.0: Higher number = less sensitive checking for unsportsmanlike driving

Sound Options.Buffer Count#: Controls size of mixing buffer, small values reduce latency but can cause skipping; latency = 1ms * value, which doesn't include driver/card/OS latencies (which are humongous on Windows)!
Sound Options.Clip Limiter#: Automatic output limiter that prevents clipping in loud situations
Sound Options.Engine Volume Reduction#: 0.0-1.0 How much engine volume will be reduced after 53.3 m/s, linearly, until 80 m/s
Sound Options.External Volume Ratio#: Balance between internal and external sounds for legacy cars, representing the ratio of the external volume
Sound Options.Listener Mode#: 0/1, Listener Mode. 0 uses view, 1 uses camera microphone setup
Sound Options.Master Volume#: 0.0-1.0, Master Volume. Affects the whole game
Sound Options.Onboard Volume Multiplier#: Volume multiplier for onboard cameras. Typically, cars are a lot louder on the inside than they are when far away. This lowers the game's volume when riding onboard
Sound Options.Pit Volume#: 0.0-1.0, controls volume of pit sounds while you're at the monitor
Sound Options.Player Volume Ratio#: Additional volume multiplier for player's vehicle
Sound Options.Rain Volume Mult#: Simulation will adjust rain volume derived from rain intensity. This parameter will either reduce or enhance that adjustment.
Sound Options.Realtime In Monitor#: Whether to play realtime sounds in monitor
Sound Options.Reverb Max Dist#: Distance from wall at which reverb drops to zero
Sound Options.Selected HRTF Dataset#: -1->None selected, 0-MAX->Index of selected MHR according to internal enumeration (see trace). Dataset used for virtual 3D sound
Sound Options.Speed Of Sound#: 340m/s at sea level, but lower numbers help exaggerate the Doppler effect
Sound Options.Thunder Volume Mult#: Simulation will adjust thunder volume derived from storm intensity and distance. This parameter will either reduce or enhance that adjustment.
Sound Options.Track Load Commentary#: Whether or not the commentator should talk during track loading
Sound Options.Trackside Default Exp Shape#: New exponential shape attenuation for pithorn and the default for other trackside sounds in CAM file
Sound Options.Trackside Default Range#: Volume range parameter for pithorn and the default for other trackside sounds in CAM file

Miscellaneous.CEF Mode#: CEF Render Mode (GPU Sync, GPU, CPU)
Miscellaneous.UI Auto Switch with Mod#: Some mods include their own UI.  Should we automaticly change the UI when that mod is selected?
Miscellaneous.UI State#: bitfield to save the prefered state of the options.  (Car spinner vs Car tree list)
Miscellaneous.enable UI Keyboard Nav#: enables keyboard navigation (enter forwards, esc backwards) through the UI

DRIVING AIDS.Drive AI Physics#: Only works in Dev builds, single player when you toggle to AI "control"
DRIVING AIDS.Old Tire Model#: Only works in Dev builds, drive with old tire model

Graphic Options.Gap Check#: Test for verts that are within X meters but not the exact same, reported to trace.txt and visible by pressing Ctrl-H three times (Dev build only; 0.0 to disable)
Graphic Options.Real Road System#: If true, dynamic road effects are used (can only be turned off in Dev mode)
